I would give this response a grade of 80.

The student correctly identifies the literal meaning of "evangelist" as someone who preaches the good news, which is a crucial understanding for grasping the role of an evangelist in sharing the gospel. Additionally, they provide some context about the traditional authors of the four Gospels and their role in spreading the message of Jesus Christ.

However, I would deduct points because the response could be more thorough in exploring the broader implications of being an evangelist. While they mention the Great Commission, they don't elaborate on what this means practically or how it relates to everyday Christian life. To fully understand the role of an evangelist, one needs to consider not just the historical context but also the modern-day application.

Overall, while this response is a good starting point, it could be more comprehensive in its treatment of the concern about understanding the role of an evangelist in sharing the gospel.
